unnormalised: Mumbai – Accurate inventory forecasting is becoming increasingly crucial for Indian manufacturers navigating volatile markets. Experts at IIT Delhi highlight the importance of leveraging data analytics to predict demand fluctuations. Dr. Sharma, a leading professor in supply chain management, emphasizes that even small improvements in forecasting can result in significant cost savings for businesses.

unnormalised: Poor forecasting leads to stockouts, delayed deliveries, and excess inventory clogging up valuable warehouse space, potentially costing Rs. Lakhs annually. Conversely, accurate forecasting enables optimized production schedules, reduced warehousing needs (think smaller, more efficient godowns - perhaps 5000 sq ft instead of 10000 sq ft), and improved customer satisfaction.

unnormalised: Companies are increasingly adopting sophisticated forecasting software and techniques like machine learning to analyze historical sales data, market trends, and even seasonal factors like Diwali sales spikes. Ultimately, robust inventory forecasting allows businesses, from garment exporters in Tirupur to auto component manufacturers in Pune, to stay ahead of the curve and maintain a competitive edge.
